New Records: Kieffer Moore’s opener was timed at 37 seconds – Wales’ fastest goal since 2003.
Karl Darlow became Wales’ oldest debutant since World War II.
Key Match Events: Kieffer Moore and Harry Wilson gave Wales a dream start with a quickfire double inside three minutes.
Moore’s opener ended Wales' longest scoreless streak of four games since September 2012.
Driton Camaj set up a grandstand finish, but Wales held on for three points.
Ethan Ampadu was booked in a frenetic opening.
Nikola Krstovic sent Stefan Mugosa’s cross inches wide.
Stevan Jovetic struck the crossbar with an audacious effort from inside his own half.
Karl Darlow made a fine close-range stop from Jovetic.
Ben Davies made a superb goal-line clearance to deny Camaj.
Vladimir Jovovic struck an upright from 20 yards.
Driton Camaj tapped home into an empty net after Krstovic raced clear.
Pre-Game Insights: Niksic was hosting its first men’s senior international after Podgorica’s national stadium pitch had been declared unplayable by UEFA.
Montenegro recalled former Manchester City striker Stevan Jovetic, their all-time leading scorer but currently without a club at the age of 34.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a rain-lashed night in Niksic.
There were numerous crunching challenges on a surface that inevitably cut up after incessant rain.
Wales’ 800-plus following headed just over 50 kilometres north of the Montenegrin capital.
